node.title: Inflation forecast to go even higher: What you need to know
node.description: ANZ has warned that it expects inflation will hit 7.4 percent in the second quarter, but it wasn't long ago that news it had reached 5.9 percent set alarm bells ringing. Here's what you need to know. Video

node.title: Point-of-sale retail trends changing as customers adopt new payment methods
node.description: Point-of-sale trends are changing at a rapid pace as more consumers use digital currency and other payment methods at the checkout.

node.title: Wastewater tests around New Zealand detecting 10 times more Covid-19 weekly
node.description: A Covid-19 wastewater researcher says the amount of the virus detected has been increasing rapidly with Auckland, Northland and the Bay of Plenty showing the highest levels. Audio

node.title: Covid-19: Most MIQ facilities to close by end of June
node.description: MIQ hotels could soon be sitting empty, as the government moves to shut down all but four of the country's 32 MIQ facilities by the end of June. Audio

node.title: Madison Cawthorn charged with driving with revoked license
node.description: It's the congressman's third traffic offense reported by highway patrol over recent months.

node.title: Price of anti-radiation pills spikes as Putin rattles saber
node.description: Europeans fearing that Russia's attack on Ukraine could lead to a nuclear incident are stocking up on potassium iodide pills.

node.title: Russia risks "imminent" default on its debt, say Wall Street analysts
node.description: Since Russia invaded Ukraine, its banks have been cut off from international finance and its currency has collapsed.

node.title: New York man accused of assaulting Capitol police officer on Jan. 6
node.description: "I didn't survive a war to go out like this," the police officer recalled thinking as he fell, according to the court documents.

node.title: KiwiSaver scheme told to remove misleading advertising
node.description: The Financial Markets Authority has ordered the low-fee KiwiSaver provider Simplicity to remove misleading advertising and improve its compliance.

node.title: Series of wildfires burns more than 34,000 acres across Florida Panhandle
node.description: As of Wednesday, there are around 120 wildfires burning throughout the state.

node.title: Andy Murray to donate this year's prize money to children in Ukraine
node.description: The three-time Grand Slam champion said he's working with UNICEF to provide urgent medical supplies and early childhood development kits.

node.title: Calls grow across U.S. for "gas tax holiday"
node.description: With gas prices at record highs, more state lawmakers say suspending gas taxes would offer relief to motorists at the pump.

node.title: Stocks jump, oil drops in latest dizzying swing for markets
node.description: Investors see "glimmer of hope" in scheduled meeting in Turkey between Ukraine and Russian officials.

node.title: Ukraine invasion: China eyes the Indo-Pacific  - Australian intelligence boss
node.description: Australia's intelligence chief says a "troubling new strategic convergence" between Beijing and Moscow has developed and the risk of "major power conflict" has grown since Russia invaded Ukraine.

node.title: Neurodiverse theater company shines light on inclusion
node.description: Founded in 2016, EPIC Players provides professional performing arts opportunities to a diverse cast of artists.

node.title: 'Radical change': The Northland meth rehab programme that works
node.description: The Detail - A recent evaluation report found there had been a 34 percent reduction in harm from offending among the people Te Ara Oranga has helped.

node.title: All Whites name extended squad for World Cup qualifiers
node.description: Wellington Phoenix players get call-up for All Whites' World Cup qualifiers.

node.title: SpaceX continues rapid-fire launch pace
node.description: SpaceX has sent Starlink terminals to Ukraine to help keep the embattled nation connected to the western world

node.title: Ukrainian lawmaker and social media warrior discusses the battle online
node.description: Web exclusive: David Pogue's extended conversation with Inna Sovsun, a professor and Ukrainian Parliament member who's now active in the social-media resistance.

node.title: Former Trump adviser Stephen Miller sues January 6 select committee
node.description: T-Mobile was served with a subpoena for Miller's phone records in late February, according to the complaint filed by the former Trump adviser.

node.title: These companies continue to do business in Russia
node.description: Although public pressure is building on major corporations to exit the country, a number of prominent players carry on.

node.title: Thames-Coromandel mayor to remain unvaccinated despite Novavax claims
node.description: The arrival of the Novavax vaccine in Aotearoa won't change the Thames-Coromandel mayor's Covid-19 vaccination status. Audio

node.title: Surgical bus sees surge in demand for cancer surveillance
node.description: Country Life: The Mobile Health service's "operating theatre on wheels" is picking up many more cancer cases than in the past, says chief executive Mark Eager. Audio

node.title: Russia's military weaknesses exposed in Ukraine, former commander says
node.description: Retired Lieutenant General Ben Hodges said that Russia's invasion of Ukraine has exposed its shortcomings.

node.title: 'People can't even afford a $2 sausage': Struggle with basics as living costs rise
node.description: Families across Aotearoa are struggling to make ends meet as the cost of living rises, and they are being forced to make the tough calls over the basics. Audio

node.title: Yes, banks are still lending to Donald Trump
node.description: A bank's decision to loan Donald Trump's company $100 million is the latest evidence the former president might survive fraud investigations.

node.title: Colorado elections clerk indicted in voting system breach
node.description: The indictment alleges Peters was part of a "deceptive scheme" to breach voting system technology that is used across the country.

node.title: New images released after couple stabbed to death while riding bikes
node.description: "This is probably one of the most vicious and gruesome incidents that I've witnessed in my 20 years," Daytona Police Chief Jakari Young said.

node.title: 18 attacks on Ukrainian hospitals and ambulances, WHO says
node.description: A children's hospital and maternity facility in Mariupol suffered "colossal" damage from what Ukrainian officials said was a Russian strike.

node.title: BMW recalls 900,000 vehicles, most for 3rd time, over fire risk
node.description: An engine fire risk can occur while overheated cars and SUVs are being driven or soon after they are parked.
